customer_name: Southwest Virginia Wildlife Center of Roanoke
site_name: SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WILDLIFE CENTER OF ROANOKE INC

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a written program of veterinary care identifying their part-time attending veterinarian. The facility
employs a part-time veterinarian to provide veterinary care to the animals but there is no written program of veterinary
care. A written program of veterinary care is important to ensure their are formal arrangements between the facility and
the attending veterinarian regarding health care for the animals and regularly scheduled visits to the premise. Correct by
April 25, 2023 by ensuring there is a written program of veterinary care identifying the Attending Veterinarian and regularly
scheduled visits to the premises.

The facility does not have a perimeter fence surrounding the outdoor opossum enclosures. A perimeter fence serves as
additional protection for the animals by restricting animals and unauthorized persons from having direct contact with the
animals as well as providing a secondary containment system for animals inside the facility if they should escape their
primary enclosure. Correct by May 16, 2023 by ensuring all outdoor housing facilities are enclosed by a perimeter fence
at least 6 feet high.

There is an excessive accumulation of trash and junk behind the education animal housing area. According to the facility,
a building was just removed and they are continuing to remove old trash, debris, and accumulations of junk in preparation
for a new building to be installed. It is important that the premises around buildings are kept clean to protect animals from
injury if they were to escape and to prevent the harborage of pests. Correct by May 9, 2023 by ensuring all premises are
kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the animals from injury and to facilitate the prescribed husbandry
practices set forth in Subpart F.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Kristina D'Apice, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
